author: Special Correspondent
text:
Say both the Congress and BJP were against their welfare

Condemning “anti-trader” policies of the Department of Commercial Taxes, traders staged a demonstration in front of Tirunelveli railway junction on Tuesday.

The traders said that the new regulations stipulated by the Department of Commercial Taxes had mandated the computerisation of the stocks and business of every establishment, property surety for acquiring of Tax Identification Number (TIN), hefty penal of 300 per cent for every mistake of the trader etc.

“If the supplier fails to pay tax for the product he sold, the buyer must pay it, as per the new proposal. If the anti-trader policies are not withdrawn, we’ll commence an indefinite strike,” said M.R. Subramanian, who presided over the agitation.

Two-wheeler rally

The Tamil Nadu Vanigar Sangangalin Peravai, which is organising a two-wheeler rally from Chennai to mobilise traders’ support against the proposals of Department of Commercial Taxes, reached Palayamkottai on Tuesday.

Addressing traders, its president T. Vellaiyan said that both the Congress and the Bharatiya Janata Party were against the welfare of traders as these parties were supporting World Trade Agreement. “Hence, the traders will support neither the Congress nor the BJP and will back the /parties which are for the traders’ welfare in the Assembly polls,” Mr. Vellaiyan said.
title: Traders against new tax regulations
